3.t: proclaim the greatness of your Lord,

6.t: and do not think that by doing such deeds, you have done a great favor to God.

7.t: Exercise patience to please your Lord.

9.t: it will be a hard day

10.t: and for the disbelievers, in particular, it will not be at all easy.

11.t: Leave to Me the one, whom I have created all by Myself,

12.t: and whom I have granted abundant wealth

13.t: and children living in his presence,

14.t: whose life I have made run smoothly

16.t: Never will he receive more. He has been hostile to Our revelations.

17.t: We shall make him suffer the torment of hell without relief.

20.t: What an evil plan he has made!

21.t: May he be condemned again for his schemes! He looked around,

23.t: then turned back, and swelling-up with pride,

24.t: said, "This (the Quran) is nothing but magic, inherited from ancient magicians.
24.tr: Faqaala in haazaaa illaa sihruny yu'sar

25.t: These are only words from a mere mortal".

26.t: I shall make him suffer the torment of hell.

27.t: Would that you really knew what hell is!

28.t: It leaves and spares no one and nothing.

30.t: and it has nineteen angelic keepers.

31.t: We have made only angels as the keepers of the fire (for they are the strongest in carrying out Our commands). Our informing (people) of the numbers of these angels is a trial for the disbelievers. It gives more certainty to the people of the Book and strengthens the faith of the believers. The people of the Book and the believers have no doubt about it. We have fixed the number to make the disbelievers and those whose hearts are sick say, "What does God mean by such a parable?" Thus, God guides and causes to go astray whomever He wants. No one knows about the army of your Lord except He Himself. This parable is a reminder for mankind.
31.tr: Wa-maa ja'alnaaa As-haaban naari illaa malaaa-'ikatanw Wa-maa ja'alnaa 'iddatahum illaa fitnatal lillazeena kafaroo liyastaiqinal lazeena ootul kitaaba Wa-yazdaadal lazeena aamanooo eemaananw Wa-laa yartaabal lazeena ootul kitaaba walmu'minoona Wa-liyaqoolal lazeena fee quloo-bihim maradunw walkaafiroona maazaaa araadal laahu bihaazaa masalaa; kazaalika yudillul laahu mai yashaaa'u Wa-yahdee mai yashaaa'; Wa-maa ya'lamu junooda rabbika illaa hoo; Wa-maa hiya illaa zikraa lil-bashar

35.t: hell is certainly the greatest calamity.

36.t: It is a warning for mankind

37.t: whether one steps forward to embrace the faith or one turns away from it.
37.tr: Liman shaaa'a minkum any yataqaddama aw yata-akhkhar

38.t: Every soul will be in captivity for its deeds

39.t: except the people of the right hand

41.t: and will ask of the criminals,

43.t: They will reply, "We did not pray,

44.t: nor did we feed the destitute.

45.t: We indulged and persisted in useless disputes,

46.t: and rejected the Day of Judgment

48.t: The intercession of the intercessors will be of no benefit to them.

49.t: If such will be the Day of Judgment, what is the matter with them? Why do they run away from guidance,

52.t: Is it that everyone of them wants to receive a heavenly book addressed to him personally?
52.tr: Bal yureedu kullum ri'im minhum any yu'taa suhufam munashsharah

53.t: This will certainly never be the case! In fact, they are not afraid of the Day of Judgment.

54.t: There is no doubt that the Quran is a guide.

55.t: Let anyone who seeks guidance do so.

56.t: No one will seek guidance unless God wills it. He alone is worthy of being feared and He is the Source of Forgiveness.
56.tr: Wa-maa yazkuroona illaaa any yashaaa'al laah; Huwa ahlut taqwaa Wa-ahlul maghfirah
